landlord_tenant_relationship.reasoning: Complaint alleges Plaintiff is a tenant who took possession on 1/15/2022, pays $1,200/month, and that Defendant leased the premises to Plaintiff (month-to-month tenancy/lease referenced).

act_or_omission_by_landlord.reasoning: Complaint alleges Defendant arranged an inspection but has not authorized or completed necessary electrical repairs, has not provided a schedule or a safe alternative, and has failed to restore service despite notice—an omission/failure to act.

substantial_interference.reasoning: Factual allegations show a complete loss of electricity in one bedroom rendering it unusable as a home office, relocation of equipment, impaired living conditions, and loss of use of roughly 50% of the sleeping/office space — pleaded as a material/substantial interference.

causation.reasoning: Plaintiff pleads that an electrician identified defective wiring and that Defendant's failure to authorize/complete repairs after notice proximately caused the continued loss of electricity and resulting loss of use.

damages.reasoning: Complaint pleads out-of-pocket expenses (coworking fees, daily expenses), loss of use/diminished enjoyment, an estimated $900 to date, and seeks compensatory damages and rent abatement.
